intro: Scabiosa ochroleuca var. calcarea, commonly known as the limestone scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its pale yellow to white flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils, thriving in rocky or limestone-rich environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
